Auckland Harbour Bridge lanes to close for Toitū te Tiriti hīkoi protest, NZTA warns of ‘significant congestion’ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/auckland-harbour-bridge-lanes-to-close-for-toitu-te-tiriti-hikoi-protest-nzta-warns-motorists-of-significant-congestion/ 37BTSQ5W65B2TN55W33U4QWZSQ/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/auckland-harbour-bridge-lanes-to-close-for-toitu-te-tiriti-hikoi-protest-nzta-warns-motorists-of-significant-congestion/ 37BTSQ5W65B2TN55W33U4QWZSQ/ Hundreds of protesters have gathered on North Shore tonight ahead of tomorrow's march. Tue, 12 Nov 2024 06:11:12 +0000 Lanes will be closed on Auckland Harbour Bridge during rush hour tomorrow morning to make way for a hīkoi protest. Photo / Michael Craig
Police say gang patches in public places will not be tolerated when new laws begin https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/police-say-gang-patches-in-public-places-will-not-be-tolerated-when-new-laws-begin/FFL34Y2M6BDULBNCGFUL3HEDII/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/police-say-gang-patches-in-public-places-will-not-be-tolerated-when-new-laws-begin/FFL34Y2M6BDULBNCGFUL3HEDII/ The new laws will come into effect on November 21. Tue, 12 Nov 2024 05:41:34 +0000 Displaying gang patches in public places will not be tolerated, police say.

Tue, 12 Nov 2024 05:30:02 +0000 The Ōmāhu community and those involved with building and placing the 11 relocatable homes on marae land between Napier and Hastings gather to celebrate the milestone. Photo / Doug Laing

Urgent search under way for missing 9yo girl in Hamilton https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/urgent-search-under-way-for-missing-9yo-girl-in-hamilton/AVAZT5X2TNA7NHXZ2P7PSVAMYA/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/urgent-search-under-way-for-missing-9yo-girl-in-hamilton/AVAZT5X2TNA7NHXZ2P7PSVAMYA/ Jasmine was last seen wearing a black cap, black Nike Hoodie and brown pants. Much-loved Canterbury teenager dies during Woodend touch rugby warm-up https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/much-loved-canterbury-teen-dies-during-touch-rugby-warm-up/FUBS6IMACBFPLJDLWCXKRA7GDM/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/much-loved-canterbury-teen-dies-during-touch-rugby-warm-up/FUBS6IMACBFPLJDLWCXKRA7GDM/ Brook Wilson is remembered as a great mate who lived his life to the fullest. Tue, 12 Nov 2024 05:00:00 +0000 Brooke Wilson (inset) with friends in Christchurch. Wilson died while warming up for a game of touch rugby for the Woodend Rugby Club on November 6.
Mongrel Mob teen Tana Ormsby-Turner rejects early parole, faces prison violence https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/mongrel-mob-teen-tana-ormsby-turner-rejects-early-parole-faces-prison-violence/ZEFA4KZ6LRFSDO5LMSS65HYBPQ/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/mongrel-mob-teen-tana-ormsby-turner-rejects-early-parole-faces-prison-violence/ZEFA4KZ6LRFSDO5LMSS65HYBPQ/ Tara ShaskeyTana Ormsby-Turner has assaulted inmates and racked up misconducts while inside. Tue, 12 Nov 2024 05:00:00 +0000 Teen Mongrel Mob member Tana Ormsby-Turner was jailed for his involvement in the murder of an Uru Taha prospect. He is now eligible for parole.
Abuse in state care: Redress questions remain unanswered for survivors amid landmark apology https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/politics/abuse-in-state-care-redress-questions-remain-unanswered-for-survivors-amid-landmark-apology/RIKR5WUQI5F47IKMQUUZDNMO3E/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/politics/abuse-in-state-care-redress-questions-remain-unanswered-for-survivors-amid-landmark-apology/RIKR5WUQI5F47IKMQUUZDNMO3E/ Adam PearseIt was an emotional and at times, hostile, day as the Government made its formal apology. Photo / Mark Mitchell
‘Going the extra mile’: Kwaks win Nan Evans Volunteer Award for community service in Gisborne https://www.nzherald.co.nz/gisborne-herald/news/going-the-extra-mile-kwaks-win-nan-evans-volunteer-award-for-community-service-in-gisborne/MDKYDNOOHFEC5LJ4W4VDYTA4V4/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/gisborne-herald/news/going-the-extra-mile-kwaks-win-nan-evans-volunteer-award-for-community-service-in-gisborne/MDKYDNOOHFEC5LJ4W4VDYTA4V4/ Wynsley WrigleyHans Kwak: 'The award is as much for Trish as it is for me.' Tue, 12 Nov 2024 04:22:31 +0000 Tairāwhiti Community Voice's outgoing president Joan-Ella Ngata (right) congratulates Nan Evans Award-winners Hans and Trish Kwak.
